item.title: Goodbye 182 day streak
item.description: Today I’m ending my love affair with duolingo, have just signed up for a year of memrise. Let’s see if I can finally git gud at Russian :)

item.title: Org mode reference card
item.description: Great little reference for org mode syntax.

item.title: Magit Forge on macOS
item.description: I’ve tried many editor git integrations over the years, in Vim, VS Code, IntelliJ, Sublime, as well as various git guis. However I’ve never found something nearly as powerful and efficient day to day as working on the command line. While I will probably never give up the command line, with Emacs’ Magit I’ve finally found a valuable companion which feels as powerful and efficient as the cli interface. The magit status window is a super powerful base point for most git operations.

item.title: Modern rust alternatives for Unix classics
i3-grid - easily handle floating windows in i3
item.description: i3 is my favorite window manager ever, and it works great for tiling, but sometimes you need a floating window, and typically that has meant resorting to the dreaded mouse, or clumsy keybindings. i3-grid promises to fix this. Check out the demo from the README, it’s pretty neat!

item.title: How I'm running Home Assistant in docker on NixOS
item.description: For the last few years I’ve been into home automation, and since I buy random stuff from different vendors and with various protocols, I use Home Assistant to tie it all together. My main home server is a NixOS box, but for a long while I was running home assistant on my old Arch mac mini, because it was such a chore to handle dependencies with the NixOS home assistant service.
